title: Food and Cooking
summary: Essential vocabulary to talk about food types and cooking methods, including fruits, vegetables, meats, seafood, and preparation techniques.

sections.heading: Fruits and Vegetables
sections.content: This section covers common fruits and vegetables with descriptions and examples.

examples.definition: Small round fruits used to make wine.
examples.example: Grapes are used to make wine.

examples.definition: Small, round fruit with red skins, often used in desserts.
examples.example: Cherries are small, round fruit with red skins, often used in desserts.

examples.definition: Sweet summer fruit with pinky-orange skin.
examples.example: A peach is a sweet summer fruit with pinky-orange skin.

examples.definition: Long, thin vegetables with orange skin and flesh.
examples.example: Carrots are long, thin vegetables with orange skin and flesh.

examples.definition: Nutritious green vegetable.
examples.example: Broccoli is a nutritious green vegetable.

examples.definition: Vegetable with smooth, dark purple skin.
examples.example: An aubergine (UK) or eggplant (US) has a smooth, dark purple skin.

sections.heading: Meat, Fish & Seafood
sections.content: This section covers different types of meat, fish and seafood.

examples.definition: Meat of a cow.
examples.example: Beef is the meat of a cow.

examples.definition: White meat from a bird, considered healthy.
examples.example: Chicken is white meat from a bird, and it's considered to be healthy.

examples.definition: Meat of a pig.
examples.example: Pork is the meat of a pig.

examples.definition: Popular fish with pink meat.
examples.example: Salmon is a popular fish with pink meat.

examples.definition: Seafood with tasty, soft meat inside.
examples.example: Prawns have a tasty, soft meat inside.

examples.definition: Seafood with smooth black shell and orange flesh.
examples.example: Mussels have a smooth black shell and orange flesh.

sections.heading: Cooking Methods
sections.content: This section covers different ways to prepare and cook food.

examples.definition: Cooked in vapour over boiling water, considered healthy.
examples.example: I ordered steamed fish with vegetables.

examples.definition: Cooked in very hot water, a healthy preparation method.
examples.example: Boiled eggs are healthier than fried eggs.

examples.definition: Cooked in oil or fat in a frying pan.
examples.example: I had a fried egg for breakfast.

examples.definition: Cooked in the oven using flour and yeast.
examples.example: I could smell the freshly baked bread.

examples.definition: Cooked for a long time in the oven or over a fire.
examples.example: The chicken was served with roasted potatoes.

sections.heading: Food-related Phrasal Verbs
sections.content: This section covers common phrasal verbs used when talking about food and eating habits.

examples.definition: To eat away from home, in a restaurant.
examples.example: We often eat out at the weekend.

examples.definition: To consume less of something.
examples.example: I'm trying to cut down on red meat.

examples.definition: To follow a special eating plan to lose weight.
examples.example: Tom went on a diet because he needed to lose a few kilos.

examples.definition: To become heavier.
examples.example: I put on all the weight that I had lost.
